conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each inlet (A, B, C, and D) and how it interacts with the baffles.
Liquid flows downward from inlet A.
Liquid from inlet A encounters the red baffle first, which directs it to the right.
Liquid from inlet A hits the green baffle, which further directs it to the right.
Liquid from inlet A continues to flow rightward and then downward, passing under the white baffle.
Liquid from inlet A reaches the bottom and flows into container E.
Liquid flows downward from inlet B.
Liquid from inlet B encounters the red baffle first, which directs it to the right.
Liquid from inlet B hits the green baffle, which further directs it to the right.
Liquid from inlet B continues to flow rightward and then downward, passing under the white baffle.
Liquid from inlet B reaches the bottom and flows into container E.
Liquid flows downward from inlet C.
Liquid from inlet C encounters the pink baffle first, which directs it to the left.
Liquid from inlet C hits the gray baffle, which further directs it to the left.
Liquid from inlet C continues to flow leftward and then downward, passing under the white baffle.
Liquid from inlet C reaches the bottom and flows into container F.
Liquid flows downward from inlet D.
Liquid from inlet D encounters the blue baffle first, which directs it to the left.
Liquid from inlet D hits the black baffle, which further directs it to the left.
Liquid from inlet D continues to flow leftward and then downward, passing under the white baffle.
Liquid from inlet D reaches the bottom and flows into container F.
Liquid from inlets A and B will flow into container E; liquid from inlets C and D will flow into container F.
